name: Hilton Garden Inn Albany / SUNY Area

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights while in Albany on business. Check in was a breeze. Room was very clean and quiet. The hotel itself had a good fitness center. Very convenient to the interstate, the state offices and to SUNY.
reviews.title: Very clean business hotel

reviews.text: Nice room for the money. Convenient to SUNY Albany campus. Only problem, not enough parking spaces. The room was well maintained and clean. Beds were the sleep number where you can change the fairness, I couldn't get the dial to work. Not a comfortable bee.
reviews.title: Clean Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed at this place a couple of times before as it is a very convenient location for visiting family and friends in the area; however, we had avoided the hotel’s restaurant since we know lots of good places to eat in Albany and Schenectady. This time we were “caught” by a time deadline in meeting a friend, and with a confusing road construction project nearby, we took the easy way out and dined in. Surprise, surprise! I had one of the best spinach salads that I’ve ever had at a restaurant for my main course, and in 11 days on the road, my husband declared his burger the best of the trip.
reviews.title: Choice of Giants

reviews.text: We enjoyed drinks with our friend in a nicely furnished, quiet room off the lobby, which we considered a bonus. Our entertainment for the evening was watching NY Giants players walk in from practice on the SUNY campus. (The very fact that high-paid team members stay here says a lot for the hotel.)
reviews.title: stay away

reviews.text: We had no complaints about our room whatsoever—it’s a standard Hilton Garden Inn, in my opinion better than average for the chain. I did notice a bit of a downgrade in its giveaway amenities over what was offered years ago, but this is small potatoes. We’ll be happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Charged for cancelled rooms

reviews.text: I have never stayed at a Hilton before, because I knew the hotel chain was pricier than other hotels. I got an okay deal on priceline, so I decided to try it out. Well, for what they were charging, I was surprised at the amenities.
reviews.title: For the Hilton name it was lacking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, they told me there was a freezer/fridge in the room. Since my children have allergies, I packed freezer meals and carefully stored them in our cooler until we arrived. When we got there, I put them in the "freezer", cranked down the temp. And the next morning, 60.00 worth of "allergy free" meals were defrosted and ruined. My kids had to eat oatmeal for breakfast, lunch and dinner the entire trip.
reviews.title: A nice place for a great price

reviews.text: Next, I had a very bad reaction to mold in the bathroom. And while I am sensitive to mold, I usually don't react as badly as I did (throat closing, eyes swelling). When I asked the management to give me a refund so I could find another hotel, they acted as if I was trying to pull one over on them and said that "If I'm trying to get a refund so I can stay at the (adjacent hotel), they don't issue refunds". They did put me in another room, and we made sure not to use the shower or allow any steam in the bathroom. And we stayed out of the bathroom. I ended up being sick the rest of my vacation. Nicely enough, they did bring us a coupon for an appetizer and a dessert to the restaurant downstairs.
reviews.title: Great people very friendly

reviews.text: The towel brackets in the shower were rusty and when I did take a towel, it had rust lines on it from the bracket. It kind of stuck onto the bracket a little and I had to pull it off. The towels did not smell fresh.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: The water pressure in the shower was erratic, and I had to have the water on either scalding hot, or lukewarm.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: One of those places that doesnt actually let you control the temperature. Gives you a thermostat, but no matter how low you set the tenperature, room temp will not go below 72 degrees. Asked about it at front desk. Pleaded ignorance. Cant be the first person to complain about that.
reviews.title: Dont actually allow you to control room temp.

reviews.text: Family of three for a one night stay in the Capitol District. Pretty standard HGI with small and average pool and workout room. Room was nice and clean. Free Wifi and parking, although it appeared that the parking filled-up fast! This HGI is not walking distance to anything save a few other hotels. Note: although it is directly across the street from the University, this is not a walking friendly environment.
reviews.title: Average for HGI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not partake in breakfast so I cannot speak to it's quality. However, for $9.95 per adult and $6.95 per child, there are better options. In a pinch, there is a Dunkin Donuts about .2 miles NW on Washington. Easy.
reviews.title: Not enough parking, so-so housekeeping

reviews.text: This is a good hotel to get to/from Capitol District as you are Washington Avenue. We needed easy place for family dinner after long day. Headed down Washington Ave toward Capital to find "A Better Bite" New York Deli. Something everyone, then a nice stroll around the beautiful buildings. Recommend.
reviews.title: The pictures online do not do justice!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for two nights while attending the 2012 Old Songs Festival. It's an OK place to stay, but getting dated in places. The rooms seemed small for an HGI property by today's standards, and the carpeting in my room was stained.
reviews.title: It's an HGI, But Lacks A Bit

reviews.text: This is a very good hotel in Albany, centrally located to everything. Courteous staff and everything was clean. We had a hard time getting the bed to a comfortable setting for us, but overall had a nice stay and will certainly consider staying here again the next time we are in the area.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in Albany

reviews.text: A very nice hotel across from the State University at Albany on Washington Ave. The staff is limited - no bellhops for example, but they are without exception friendly, knowledgable and helpful. The restaurant serves a very good if limited breakfast and a lite supper, and you can get a drink till 10:00 PM - but not a minute later! Our third time staying here, again with a small family group, and we were able to take over the "living room" area behind the fireplace to socialize after we returned from dinner the second evening - very pleasant and comfortable. The rooms are good-sized and everything is clean and well maintained, the bed very good and the price reasonable. What more can you want! Most things are included, including responsive internet access, except notably local phone service. Why do hotels and other travel service providers try and extract the last dime from every guest when all it does is upset them. We stayed in another place when we returned because of this - bummer!
reviews.title: Good hotel with fime rooms and a nice but limited restaurant

reviews.text: The hotel is nicely appointed and well taken care of. The building is so close to the Interstate that you could almost collect tolls from your room window. The noise is so constant and loud that even the double windows still do not damper it. It looks like you would have the same level of noise from either the front or back of the building, but I was on the back and I am guessing the front must be worse.
reviews.title: BRING EARPLUGS AND PREVIOUS SOUND SLEEP EXPERIENCE

reviews.text: There is minimal parking around the building and everyone seems to park along the driveway or anywhere else they can find. I saw someone pulling their luggage from another property parking lot. On the brighter side, their cookies are good when you finally get to the desk. I was not impressed with any of the staff. They spoke but seemed indifferent and I went somewhere else for the next nights so I could get some rest.
reviews.title: High School Graduation trip

reviews.text: The breakfast was probably below average in quality compared to other Hilton Garden Inns, but in all honesty, few are above average. If you have a breakfast coupon they seem to forget you after they drop off your eggs.
reviews.title: Short, but great stay

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Albany / Suny Area Hotel
